info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 10 at 2:58AM CST until January 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL SOUTH PLAINS AND THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTH PLAINS, ROLLING PLAINS, AND THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM CST this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. The Fire Weather Watch is in effect from late Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * Timing... Today: Noon to 6 PM. Wednesday: 10 AM to 8 PM. * Wind... Today: West 20 to 25 mph at the 20 foot level. Wednesday: West 30 to 40 mph at the 20 foot level with gusts to 60 mph. * Humidity... Today: 10 to 15 percent. Wednesday: 11 to 18 percent. * Fuels... Dry. * Impacts... Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
